news.title: AA Snap: Democratizing Account Abstraction
news.subtitle: An ETHIndia Hackathon Winner

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask Snaps is the roadmap to making MetaMask the most extensible wallet in the world. As a developer, you can bring your features and APIs to MetaMask in totally new ways. Web3 developers are the core of this growth and this series aims to showcase the novel MetMask Snaps being built today.

AA Snap

Snap Repo: https://github.com/a42io/AAsnap

Why did you build it?

AA Snap is built for democratizing Account Abstraction (AA) for all developers and users. We believe AA will be widely used in the future. However, currently, it takes work for devs to integrate it with their dapps and for users to use it.

From devs' perspective, it's necessary to write additional code that supports AA in addition to EOA.

From users' point of view, they cannot use their usual wallets, such as MetaMask, and need to install another wallet that supports AA, which is a bad UX.

Therefore, we wanted to make it easy to integrate and use AA by utilizing MetaMask Snaps.

Can you walk us through the technical implementation?

AA Snap is composed of three components: an example frontend, the MetaMask snap, and a temporary server. The snap enables devs and users to use an AA wallet (a contract wallet that supports EIP-4337) very easily. Please see the repository for the full implementation.

The example frontend

The example frontend is based on the template that is provided by MetaMask. It shows developers can easily integrate AA with their dapps by AA Snap.

For example, a balance of the AA wallet can be fetched with the simple code below.

const balance = (await window.ethereum.request({
    method: 'wallet_invokeSnap',
    params: [
        defaultSnapOrigin,
        {
            method: 'balance',
        },
    ],
})) as string;

To send a transaction from the AA wallet, you can just write the code below by passing a beneficiary address and value.

await window.ethereum.request({
    method: 'wallet_invokeSnap',
    params: [
        defaultSnapOrigin,
        {
            method: 'transfer',
            params: {
                to,        // beneficiary address
                value,     // value in ETH or MATIC
            },
        },
    ],
});

How easy is it to use the AA wallet from the user‚Äôs perspective? Try it here: https://AAsn.app

The Snap

The snap gets an instance of AA with the code below. To implement AA, we used the @account-abstraction/sdk npm package.

Since the AA wallet address can be deterministically derived from the user‚Äôs EOA, no user input is required.

export const getAbstractAccount = async (): Promise<SimpleAccountAPI> => {
    const provider = new ethers.providers.Web3Provider(wallet as any);
    await provider.send('eth_requestAccounts', []);
    const owner = provider.getSigner();
    const aa = new SimpleAccountAPI({
        provider,
        entryPointAddress,
        owner,
        factoryAddress,
    });
    return aa;
};

There are three steps to send a transaction from the AA wallet:

  1. The snap shows a confirmation within the MetaMask using the snap‚Äôs snap_confirm method. This process is not required but is needed for better UX because there‚Äôs no way for users to know the details of what they will sign.
  2. The code creates a user operation of the AA wallet and requests to sign a hash of the user operation. This process is almost the same as creating a tx from EOA and signing it.
  3. Send the signed user operation to a bundler via our server.
export const transfer = async (target: string, ethValue: string) => {
    const value = ethers.utils.parseEther(ethValue);
    const aa = await getAbstractAccount();
    const address = await aa.getAccountAddress();

    // 1. Show confirmation within MetaMask
    const result = await wallet.request({
        method: 'snap_confirm',
        params: [{
            prompt: 'Transfer',
            description: 'Transfer from your Abstraction Account',
            textAreaContent: `from: ${address}\ntarget: ${target}\nvalue: ${ethValue}`,
        }],
    });

    if (!result) {
        return;
    }

    // 2. Create a signed user operation of AA wallet
    const op = await aa.createSignedUserOp({
        target,
        value,
        data: '0x',
        maxFeePerGas,
        maxPriorityFeePerGas,
    });

    const printedOp = await printOp(op);
    const body = JSON.stringify({
        op: printedOp,
    });

    // 3. Send a signed user operation to the bundler
    const response = await fetch(SERVER_END_POINT {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        },
        body,
    });
};

The temporary server

During the hackathon, we encountered an error when calling the sendUserOpToBundler method inside the snap. Since we didn‚Äôt have time to dig into the issue, we decided to create a server to solve the problem temporarily. The temporary server just receives the signed user operation and passes it to a bundler.

Because of the error probably came from dependencies because there are some restrictions in the MetaMask Snaps execution environment. We think the temporary server can be removed by following this document: Patching Dependencies

app.post('/aa', async (req, res) => {
  const provider = new ethers.providers.JsonRpcProvider(
    process.env.RPC_ENDPOINT,
  );
  const client = await getHttpRpcClient(
    provider,
    process.env.BUNDLER_URL as string,
    process.env.ENTRY_POINT_ADDRESS as string,
  );

  try {
    const uoHash = await client.sendUserOpToBundler(JSON.parse(req.body.op));
    return res.json({
      uoHash,
    });
  } catch (e) {
    console.log(e);
    return res.status(400).send();
  }
});

What are the next steps if you would implement this?

We would like to remove unnecessary server-side code and run the snap alone. Also, currently, it is possible for the MetaMask Snaps developer like us to replace a transaction hash to be signed with a malicious one, so we would like to introduce or propose a mechanism to prevent it.

Can you tell us a little bit about yourself and your team?

Our team is running a small startup - a42 - in Japan and Singapore. a42 is building a Web3 smart lock "wŒûlock" that enables auth with smart contracts including NFT and ENS: https://a42.io/w3lock In 2022, we attended several hackathons to learn new technologies like MetaMask Snaps.

Hideyoshi Moriya (piyo.eth): Hideyoshi has been experimenting and building Ethereum based apps since 2017. He developed a collaborative NFT art project "Pixereum" in 2017. He worked at Google as a technical product specialist and started his company "a42" in 2019. In a42, he develops dapps that can work in the real world. He is currently developing a Web3 smart lock "wŒûlock" that can be opened by ENS/NFT based on the PoC he developed in 2021: https://twitter.com/hm0429/status/1465241679800111107

Hiroyuki Tachibana (tachibana.eth): Hiroyuki is a co-founder and engineer at a42. He led a project to build a blockchain auth module for IoT devices "w3a.io" and received a grant from Ethereum Foundation. He received several prizes at ETHGlobal hackathons through 2022. He is currently developing a zkp privacy solution for the Web3 smart lock product.

Yusuke Moriya (yskmyskm.eth): Yusuke is a designer at a42. He worked as CG / VFX artist in various video productions and was involved in global brands to small-scale music videos. He has 12 years of experience in the film industry and specializes in abstract expressions using computer graphics. He has also worked as a cinematographer and documentary director.

What opportunities do you see with MetaMask Snaps and the possibilities it unlocks for the Web3 space?

We believe that MetaMask Snaps will make complex Web3 technologies easier for both developers and users and will significantly help traditional Web applications integrate with Web3. We are as excited about creating MetaMask Snaps as we were when the first mobile app store came out. We encourage you to give it a try and realize your ideas!

Any advice you would like to share with developers keen to try MetaMask Snaps?

We recommend starting with the MetaMask Snaps template (https://github.com/MetaMask/template-snap-monorepo) and modifying it first.

Tip: You may be wondering how to get the injected ethereum object. The wallet object is equivalent to it.

Building with MetaMask Snaps

To get started with MetaMask Snaps:

  1. Checkout the developer docs
  2. Install MetaMask Flask
  3. Check out a MetaMask Snaps guide
  4. Stay connected with us on Twitter, GitHub discussions, and Discord

Keep an eye out for our team at the next hackathon in an area near you! Happy BUIDLing ‚öíÔ∏è

Disclaimer: MetaMask Snaps are generally developed by third parties other the ConsenSys Software. Use of third-party-developed MetaMask Snaps is done at your own discretion and risk and with agreement that you will solely be responsible for any loss or damage that results from such activities. ConsenSys makes no express or implied warranty, whether oral or written, regarding any third-party-developed MetaMask Snaps and disclaims all liability for third-party developed Snaps. Use of blockchain-related software carries risks, and you assume them in full when using MetaMask Snaps.

image.title: How to buy crypto
image.description: Explore the ways MetaMask makes buying crypto speedy, simple, and secure.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Wondering how to buy crypto, but not sure where to start? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Buying crypto with MetaMask is swift, seamless, and safe. You can use methods like a credit card, debit card, bank account, Apple Pay, Google Pay, or PayPal. No need for centralized exchanges. We‚Äôve cut out all of the unnecessary steps ‚Äî saving you time, and money on excess fees too.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you buy cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you exactly how to buy crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ü¶ä

How MetaMask empowers you when buying crypto

  • Buy crypto straight into your MetaMask wallet.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Select from hundreds of your favorite tokens across 15+ networks including: Ethereum, Linea, Optimism, BNB Chain, Polygon, zkSync, Base, Arbitrum, and Avalanche.
  • Go from cash to crypto back to cash. All in one place.

How MetaMask wallet keeps you secure when buying crypto

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store ‚Äî nor do we have access to ‚Äî any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask wallet gives you choice buying crypto

  • Choose your preferred way to buy crypto: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, instant ACH, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, Ideal, SEPA bank transfers, and alternative local payment methods. These are subject to availability based on your region.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

If you‚Äôre using MetaMask Extension:

Clicking the Buy & Sell button on the MetaMask extension will redirect you to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Buy.
  3. Select your region, and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  5. Select the crypto token and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  6. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH Example: $100 of ETH.
  7. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers.
  8. You'll be securely redirected to the provider's website to complete the purchase, and funds will be deposited into your MetaMask wallet.

Success! ü¶ä

If you‚Äôre using the MetaMask mobile app:

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap the menu button, which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Buy
  4. Select your region and currency ‚Äî this is located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Select the crypto token and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  6. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  7. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  8. Tap Get quotes to proceed. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers.
  9. Complete the transaction on the provider‚Äôs portal, and link your desired payment method.
  10. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and confirm the transaction to get crypto in your wallet.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to get started? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app for iOS or Android.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Selling crypto for cash is as simple as can be with MetaMask. You can exchange crypto from MetaMask wallet directly to your debit card, credit card, PayPal, or bank account. No unnecessary steps, no excess fees, no worries.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you sell cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you how to sell crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ü¶ä

How MetaMask empowers you when selling crypto

  • Sell directly from your MetaMask wallet, and send cash to the place that works for you.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Buy crypto, use crypto, and sell crypto. All in one place.

How MetaMask wallet keeps you secure when selling crypto

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store ‚Äî nor do we have access to ‚Äî any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask wallet gives you choice when selling crypto

  • Choose your preferred destination for your cash including: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, and PayPal.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Sell crypto using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

Buy crypto with MetaMask Extension

Click the Buy & Sell button on MetaMask extension to redirect to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Sell.
  3. Select your region, and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Enter the amount of crypto that you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  5. Select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  6. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs website where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask Portfolio once you accept the quote.
  7. Upon returning to MetaMask Portfolio click Send ETH.
  8. Click Confirm to complete the transaction in your MetaMask wallet.

Note: You can click on Sell to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Buy crypto with MetaMask app

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap on the menu button‚Äö which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Sell.
  4. Select your region and currency‚Äîthis is located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Enter the crypto amount you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  6. Tap Send your cash to and select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal. Availability will depend on your region.
  7. Tap Get quotes to proceed.
  8. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs portal, where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask app once you accept the quote.
  9. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and tap Confirm to complete the transaction.

Note: You can tap on progress notification to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to get started? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app in the Apple Store or Google Store.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

nodes.title: Transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available in MetaMask
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.

image.title: Centralized exchange transfers MetaMask now available
image.description: Centralized exchange transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available on MetaMask.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask Portfolio now supports centralized exchange (CEX) transfers from Coinbase and Binance, streamlining the process of transferring assets to your crypto wallet.

Many web3 users have digital assets divided across multiple wallets and accounts, creating a fragmented experience. Moving assets from one platform to another can be overly complicated and involve many steps‚Äîfraught with the risks of copying and pasting addresses incorrectly, and potential security concerns. MetaMask‚Äôs new CEX transfer feature is a solution to this issue, making your wallet more powerful, while also strengthening security.

Instant transfer of assets from centralized exchanges into your MetaMask wallet

MetaMask CEX transfers allow you to immediately move assets between accounts, eliminating the need for manually entering addresses. And, if you have bank accounts linked to your Coinbase or Binance accounts, purchasing crypto directly with your bank account to your MetaMask wallet has never been easier. No additional KYC necessary.

In April 2024, MetaMask partnered with Meld and Mesh to launch a feature that allowed users to track external CEX balances by linking Coinbase or Binance accounts directly from the MetaMask Portfolio dashboard. Now, you can view CEX balances, and also transfer assets from these exchanges into your MetaMask wallet. Neither MetaMask, nor our partners in this integration, will ever have access to your exchange login credentials, or share your wallet addresses with third parties.

CEX transfers will initially support Coinbase or Binance accounts, with expansion to additional exchanges on the horizon. No fees will be charged when transferring digital assets from exchanges to MetaMask. A nominal transaction fee of 0.25% will be applied when transferring from MetaMask to centralized exchanges. Network gas fees also apply.

By bridging the gap between self-custodial and centralized platforms, MetaMask is paving the way for a more powerful, integrated, and user-friendly DeFi ecosystem. Head to MetaMask Portfolio today to get started with CEX transfers.
